item.title: lake life
item.description: Whoa, we’re halfway there. Can’t believe it’s been over a month since arriving in Chiang Mai and there’s only three weeks left. It’s gone by blazingly fast. That might be because I’ve been doing the same thing every day. It’s a coding groundhog’s day out here. However, I am happy to report that I went outside and touched some grass. It was Friday and I realized I wasn’t going to get done what I thought I would so I took off early and took a trip up to Huay Tueng Thao Reservoir.

item.title: ridin dirty
item.description: I‚Äôve forgone pursuing the Thai motorcycle license. I got so far as obtaining a certificate of residency and had all my paperwork in order, but when I went to make an appointment, there was a one and a half month wait time to get one. It‚Äôs comforting that DMV‚Äôs abroad are just like back home. I don‚Äôt really get the sense that I needed the license anyways, so for now they‚Äôre tryna to catch me ridin’ dirty.

item.title: bangkok belly
item.description: I suppose it was inevitable. And it can happen again, so I’ll need to be more careful, but I’m just getting over a miserable bout of food poisoning. Not quite out of the woods yet, but feeling well enough to write. It started on Thursday, and I think the culprit was the delicious salmon eggs benedict that I had for brunch. Yes, I had breakfast for lunch; it’s called brunch. The restaurant was often crowded and looked like a trustworthy place to eat.

item.title: out and about
item.description: After a week of being in Chiang Mai, I am time zone adjusted and no longer a zombie. This is great news as I was getting upset about it. I kept attempting to stay up until at least 9pm and kept failing and that was not a good feeling. I finally broke through Tuesday after gluing my eyelids open and made a strong determination to push through. Even though I was waking up in the dead of night, I was still able to do some stuff during the day and enjoyed touring around some.

item.title: F√ºr Elise
item.description: I am still stuck in time zone limbo. It feels like purgatory. I fell asleep too early yesterday and woke up again at 11:00pm. Not happy about that, but feeling optimistic about today’s attempt. Because coffee. I spent these twilight hours reading and learning to play the piano. I’ve never given the piano an attempt and am enjoying playing it. I’ve chosen to learn Beethoven’s “F√ºr Elise”. It is a simpler song to learn because Beethoven made this song for a woman that he was in love with.

item.title: Beginnings
item.description: I’ve arrived in Chiang Mai and I feel great about what’s to come. 2 trains, 3 planes, and 32 hours went by faster than expected. Normally when traveling for vacation I get really excited and have high energy. This time it’s different because I have possibly 7 months of travel ahead of me and it’s not exactly vacation. While “excited” is a correct word to use: calm, relaxed, and happy are more accurate.

item.title: About
item.description: Documenting my travels abroad. Posting when I can. Photos are taken with a Fujifilm X-T30 II (XF27mm F2.8 R WR lens) and an iPhone 13 Pro. This site is hosted on GitHub pages, using hugo. While traveling I’m building GymRats. Elixir, Swift, and Kotlin are my loves. Phoenix, Cocoa, and Compose are my muses. I work with a 13-inch, M1, 2020 MacBook Pro. It is ‚ù§Ô∏è‚Äçüî•. I’m learning Portuguese on Duolingo.
